summary: Response to a "Captain Marvel vs Wonder Woman" post I saw
body:
Response to a “Captain Marvel vs Wonder Woman” post I saw

Let’s all remember Diana literally never says the line “well good thing im not a man” in response to being told that no man’s land cannot be crossed by men

Steve says they can’t save everyone in this war, and she says he might not, but she will. Rewatch the whole movie or just the scene that’s less than five minutes online. If you want to nitpick the movie pick something that was actually there, not that you made up.

Yes some people are whining about Captain Marvel rn just like they whined about Wonder Woman before it came out but they are the few, don’t take note of them. I’m going to enjoy Captain Marvel when it comes out just like I did Wonder Woman, because it looks like a good movie and it has an interesting female lead.

You can like both or at the very least not condemn one to make the other look good

summary: Women: “I don’t want to see this movie because this actor/director has been accused of sexual assault.” Men: “You need to learn...
body:
Women: “I don’t want to see this movie because this actor/director has been accused of sexual assault.”

Men: “You need to learn to separate art from the creator! And besides, women lie.”

Brie Larson: “White men shouldn’t review movies” “I want more diversity in my press interviews”

Men: “Oh my gosh! How dare she speak like that! Brie Larson is a sexist and racist pig! I can’t see Captain Marvel with an actress like that, I’m boycotting the movie! We can’t support people like her!”

Men: “Oh my gosh! How dare she speak like that! Brie Larson is a sexist and racist pig! I can’t see Captain Marvel with an actress like that, I’m boycotting the movie! We can’t support people like her!”

title: The Feminist Patronum on Twitter
excerpt: “Vamos fazer nosso projeto chegar na Brie? link da vakinha pra quem puder ajudar: https://t.co/PrsocD5hKy #CapitãMarvel”
description:
To boost ticket sales for the movie, feminists arranged for ‘charities’ to be set up.

Instead of buying clothes, food or even school textbooks for girls, they are to be shipped out to see Brie Larson denigrate men.

Feminist propaganda that makes a profit out of the soft-hearted, whilst solving nothing, and merely building hatred towards their own family - their brothers, their father are to become the enemy.

Archive.

summary: Rotten Tomatoes changes audience score system to combat 'Captain Marvel' trolls
title: Rotten Tomatoes changes audience score system to combat 'Captain Marvel' trolls
body:
Rotten Tomatoes has made changes to its audience score system to prevent online trolls from tanking ‘Want to See’ ratings before release.

Recently, Captain Marvel has been targeted by negative audience comments despite the film not being released until 8 March.

The reviews aggregator site released a statement to confirm that pre-release comments and “intent to view” scores will no longer be allowed before a film’s release.

“We are disabling the comment function prior to a movie’s release date,” says a post on the Rotten Tomatoes website. “Unfortunately, we have seen an uptick in non-constructive input, sometimes bordering on trolling, which we believe is a disservice to our general readership.

“We have decided that turning off this feature, for now, is the best course of action. Don’t worry though, fans will still get to have their say: Once a movie is released, audiences can leave a user rating and comments as they always have.”

The post added, “We’re doing it to more accurately and authentically represent the voice of fans while protecting our data and public forums from bad actors.”

Rotten Tomatoes will also be remodelling other areas of its website.

“You will notice we are making some layout changes to the site,” the statement read. “Through our research department, we have learned that our users would prefer a cleaner, less cluttered, presentation of the Tomatometer and Audience Score.”

Captain Marvel hinges on a pivotal female hero (played by Brie Larson) in the Marvel Cinematic Universe – not to mention one that’s going to be key to Avengers: Endgame – but it has been subject to misogynist trolling in the same vein as that seen for movies like the all-female Ghostbusters reboot.


People have targeted the movie over feminist statements made by Larson who has recently pushed for more representation in the world of film criticism and entertainment journalism.

Though some are fighting back, the majority of the “ratings” come with tediously transparent remarks about the film’s so-called ‘agenda’, which has clearly upset more than a few chaps who are finding their masculinity in jeopardy.

Black Panther and Star Wars: The Last Jedi have also been targeted in the past.

Read more
Armie Hammer refutes Batman rumours
Fighting With My Family stars say film set culture is better
Knightley talks The Aftermath, Bend it Like Beckham

Rotten Tomatoes has made changes to its audience score system to prevent online trolls from tanking ‘Want to See’ ratings before release.

Recently, Captain Marvel has been targeted by negative audience comments despite the film not being released until 8 March.

The reviews aggregator site released a statement to confirm that pre-release comments and “intent to view” scores will no longer be allowed before a film’s release.

“We have decided that turning off this feature, for now, is the best course of action. Don’t worry though, fans will still get to have their say: Once a movie is released, audiences can leave a user rating and comments as they always have.”

The Last Jedi was also targeted by disgruntled fans

The post added, “We’re doing it to more accurately and authentically represent the voice of fans while protecting our data and public forums from bad actors.”

Though some are fighting back, the majority of the “ratings” come with tediously transparent remarks about the film’s so-called ‘agenda’, which has clearly upset more than a few chaps who are finding their masculinity in jeopardy.

summary: I wanted to make a post of my own, but randomly stumbled across this video (shoutouts to whoever this guy is!) and it is...
caption:
I wanted to make a post of my own, but randomly stumbled across this video (shoutouts to whoever this guy is!) and it is basically my own reflection.

Radical SJW hypocrisy at its finest: we support free speech as long as you agree with us, and if you don’t, we silence you.

This is just sad, tbh. 

Also, an easy way to fix the situation:

Step 1. Apologise to the fans for lying and pushing a dumb agenda.

Step 2. Make Brie Larson take back her sexist and racist words and issue a public apology and a promise that she will improve her attitude.

Step 3. Never do it again and hope your remaining fans forgive you because, at this point, I’m sensing a major decrease in the audience after Avengers: Endgame.
